tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE secure_connections (
    connection_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    connection_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    certificate_path VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    certificate_key_path VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    status ENUM('active', 'inactive')
);

CREATE TABLE ssl_certificates (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    certificate_name VARCHAR(100),
    certificate_type VARCHAR(50),
    certificate_issued_by VARCHAR(100),
    expiry_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE secure_connections (
    connection_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    connection_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    connection_host VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    connection_port INT,
    connection_protocol VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE ssl_certificates (
    cert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    cert_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    cert_expiry_date DATE,
    cert_public_key BLOB,
    cert_private_key BLOB
);

CREATE TABLE connection_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    connection_id INT,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    log_message TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (connection_id) REFERENCES secure_connections(connection_id)
);

CREATE TABLE secure_connection(
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    client_id INT NOT NULL,
    server_id INT NOT NULL,
    ssl_certificate TEXT,
    encryption_key TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE client_connections(
    connection_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    client_id INT NOT NULL,
    server_id INT NOT NULL,
    connection_status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    connection_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE server_connections(
    connection_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    server_id INT NOT NULL,
    client_id INT NOT NULL,
    connection_status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
    connection_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);
